name: Scritch
headline: AI operating system for veterinary care
description: Scritch is building the leading AI operating system for veterinary care. We provide AI agents to streamline operations including scheduling and clinical workflows.
tags: industry:consumer-health-services; industry:health-tech; industry:b2b; industry:healthcare; industry:ai; location:san-francisco-bay-area

founders.name: Claire Lee, Founder
founders.description: Claire is the co-founder & CEO of Scritch. She studied neuroscience and machine learning at Princeton. Before Scritch, she trained neural networks as a machine learning engineer in Tesla's Autopilot AI team.

founders.name: Rachel Lee, Founder
founders.description: Rachel is the co-founder & CTO of Scritch. She studied computer science at Cornell. Prior to starting Scritch, she was a software engineer at Amazon where she worked on one of the world’s most visited pages, the Amazon detail page.

generated_description:
**Company Overview: Scritch**

Founded in 2023 and nestled in the heart of San Francisco, Scritch is on a mission to redefine veterinary care by constructing a premier AI operating system tailored for the industry. Part of the esteemed Y Combinator Batch W24, Scritch is aiming high right out of the gate. The company is small but mighty with a dedicated team of just two people, including talented individuals like veterans from Tesla’s Autopilot AI and Amazon.

The core offering? An innovative suite of AI assistants designed to streamline operations within veterinary practices. Think of them as the all-in-one secret weapons for vets looking to boost their efficiency, enhance the wellbeing of their staff, and ultimately deliver superior care to furry patients. 

**AI Assistants in Action**

Scritch's AI agents, namely Emily and Mara, are designed with specific tasks in mind. Emily helps pet parents schedule appointments and gather necessary patient histories—essentially acting as a friendly front desk assistant. On the other hand, Mara is a powerhouse when it comes to documentation; she listens to appointments and types out medical records faster than you can say “vet visit,” saving veterinarians an average of two hours each day. 

Scritch isn’t just about technology; it’s about partnership and support. They invite practices to book demonstrations to see how these AI agents can fit into their workflow, promising a new standard in veterinary care efficiency.

**Conclusion**

With a solid foundation and backing from influencers in the tech world, Scritch is positing itself at the crossroads of health tech and artificial intelligence. It’s not just another startup; it’s a vision for a future where veterinary care is as advanced and efficient as it can be, all driven by cutting-edge technology.

For more information or to get onboard, check out their website at [scritchai.com](https://www.scritchai.com).
